intro: Utricularia wannanii, commonly known as the Wannan bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its small, aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit. The plant possesses specialized bladder-like structures that trap and digest small aquatic organisms. Its leaves are typically whorled and can vary in shape depending on the habitat. Utricularia wannanii thrives in moist, nutrient-poor environments and is often found in marshes or along the edges of water bodies.
